meanings.definition: To sharpen or stimulate (the appetite or desire)
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of baking cookies really whets my appetite.
meanings.sent2: A good book always whets my desire to read more.
meanings.sent3: The mouth-watering aroma of fresh popcorn whets my appetite instantly.
meanings.sent4: The intriguing movie trailer whets my curiosity like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the colorful fruits at the market whets my appetite for healthy snacks.

meanings.definition: To make keen or eager; excite
meanings.sent1: The promise of a fun day at the park whets my excitement.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming concert really whets my eagerness to attend.
meanings.sent3: The thought of a surprise party whets my excitement for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The news of the upcoming sale whets my eagerness to shop.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a new adventure whets my keenness for exploration.

meanings.definition: To sharpen by grinding or friction
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully whets his knife before slicing the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith regularly whets his tools to keep them sharp.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter whets the blade of his saw before starting the project.
meanings.sent4: The gardener whets the blades of the shears for precise pruning.
meanings.sent5: The barber skillfully whets his razor for a smooth shave.
